intro: Xerochrysum, commonly known as the golden everlasting, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers, which are often used in floral arrangements due to their long-lasting nature. The plant is native to Australia and thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Xerochrysum species are typically herbaceous, with some varieties forming compact shrubs. They are popular in gardens for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
